issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

fields.summary: Instance failure to launch - "libvirt: Domain not found: no domain with matching name" Due to HTTP 403 Error from Walrus

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.environment:
*HA Environment*

2 x CLC,Walrus
2 x CC
1 x SC
5 x NCs

comments.body: Can we see the output of euca-describe-services when this condition is happening?  Also a cat of eucarc would allow more investigation to proceed.

Harold, please see Dan's latest comments regarding this one:

"Can we see the output of euca-describe-services when this condition is happening? Also a cat of eucarc would allow more investigation to proceed."

Thanks

This issue is still present with 3.2.1. Confirmed by doing the following: * Launched an instance store-backed Windows instance * Once confirmed its running, run euca-bundle-instance, and the following error appears: {code} BundleInstanceType: Failed to bundle instance because there is no available walrus service at the moment. {code} Output below with running euca-describe-services -E followed by euca-bundle-instance with debugging, then running euca-describe-services -E again {code} [root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-services -E; euca-bundle-instance -b bundled-windows-2008-dc-x86_64 -p windows.2k8-dc-x86_64 Windows instance was prematurely terminated: {code} [root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-3F0946A0RESERVATION r-84CD457F 345590850920 default INSTANCE i-3F0946A0 emi-7D4438FD euca-192-168-55-104.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com euca-10-106-101-11.wu-tang.internal terminated admin 0 m1.xlarge 2013-02-25T03:23:11.860Z enter-the-wu monitoring-disabled 192.168.55.104 10.106.101.11 instance-store [root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-nodes | grep i-3F0946A0 NODE 10.101.39.43 rza i-3F0946A0 i-3D3B4124 {code} Contents of eucarc file {code} [root@viking-01 ~]# cat creds/eucarc | grep EC2 export EC2_URL=http://eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/Eucalyptus #export EC2_URL=http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Eucalyptus export EC2_PRIVATE_KEY=${EUCA_KEY_DIR}/euca2-admin-6445fba3-pk.pem export EC2_CERT=${EUCA_KEY_DIR}/euca2-admin-6445fba3-cert.pem export EC2_JVM_ARGS=-Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore=${EUCA_KEY_DIR}/jssecacerts export EC2_ACCOUNT_NUMBER='345590850920' export EC2_ACCESS_KEY='AIJS9LKC2C3OWBIEWYARU' export EC2_SECRET_KEY='OpqZKSPzQmYb3mQEdUGK2rsWme95FBdFzabnzC8T' export EC2_USER_ID='345590850920' alias ec2-bundle-image="ec2-bundle-image --cert ${EC2_CERT} --privatekey ${EC2_PRIVATE_KEY} --user ${EC2_ACCOUNT_NUMBER} --ec2cert ${EUCALYPTUS_CERT}" alias ec2-upload-bundle="ec2-upload-bundle -a ${EC2_ACCESS_KEY} -s ${EC2_SECRET_KEY} --url ${S3_URL}" {code} Attached are the sosreports of the Primary CLC and Node 3 where the instance that was being bundled was running.
We have a dependency on Euca2ools 2.1.3.  Can you try again and confirm this works with the right version.

Version of euca2ools used:

*CLC*
{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-version 
euca2ools 2.1.3 (Limbo)
eucalyptus 3.2.1
{code}

*NC*
{code}
# rpm -qa | grep euca
eucalyptus-admin-tools-3.2.1-0.0.516.20130205git551a6efe.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-release-3.1-1.el6.noarch
euca2ools-2.1.1-2.el6.noarch

euca2ools-release-2.1-2.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-gl-3.2.1-0.0.516.20130205git551a6efe.el6.x86_64
{code}

Will upgrade euca2ools on all NCs, then try again.

*Update*

Currently stuck on testing this due to EUCA-5286 issue.  Once thats resolved, I can move forward with testing here.
After EUCA-5286 was resolved, failed to reproduce this issue.
